question:
At 0600 your loran reads:

 9960-W-14546.3
 9960-X-25909.5
 9960-Y-43945.0

 What is your 0600 position?

options: The gyro error by observation is 2°E.
The deviation based on the observation is 15°W.
The true line of the range is 079°.
question: In order to check your compasses, you sight North Dumpling Island Light in line with Latimer Reef Light bearing 077°pgc.  The helmsman was steering 307°pgc and 320° per standard magnetic compass at the time.  Which statement is TRUE?
At 0645, Watch Hill Point (left tangent) bears 316.5°pgc at 2.75 miles.  What was the speed made good between 0600 and 0645?

You are underway in the vicinity of Block Island and obtain the following lines of position:

Montauk Point Light                                            263°pgc  
Block Island Southeast Light                               026°pgc 
Radar Bearing to Block Island  Southwest Point 348°pgc

What is your position at the time of these sightings?
What course should you steer by your standard magnetic compass to make good a course of 280°T?

options: The light comes on at sunset.
There is an emergency light if the main light is extinguished.
The height of the light is 24 feet.
The tower is painted with black and white stripes.
question: Which statement concerning Montauk Point Light is TRUE?
At 1800, your position is LAT 41°06.5'N, LONG 71°43.5'W. How would the buoy which bears 030°T from your position at a range of approximately 0.5 mile be painted?
From your 1800 position you steer a course of 350°psc at a speed of 10.0 knots.  At 1830, your position is LAT 41°11.7'N, LONG 71°45.8'W.  What are the set and drift of the current?

options: The nominal range of its white light is 15 miles.
It displays both red and white lights.
Its geographic range is 18.5 miles at a 35 foot (10.7 meter) height of eye.
Its horn blasts every 30 seconds in fog.
question: From your 1830 fix, you come left to a course of 290°T.  Which of the following statements concerning Watch Hill Light is FALSE?

At 1850, you obtain the following bearings and distances:

Montauk Point    189°pgc 8.7 miles  
Watch Hill Light  340°pgc 5.7 miles  

What true course did you make good between 1830 and 1850?
If your height of eye is 35 feet (10.7 meters), what is the approximate geographic range of Block Island North Light?

From your 1850 fix, you come left to a course of 280°T,
while maintaining a speed of 10 knots.  Which of the following combinations of available Loran-C lines would be best for position determination?

At 0705, you take the following bearings:

Watch Hill Light        034.5°pgc  
Latimer Reef Light    338.0°pgc  
Race Rock Light      268.0°pgc  

What was the true course made good between 0645 and 0705?

You decide to use the 9960-Y and 9960-W rates.  At 1915,
you obtain the following readings:

 9960-Y-43936.0
 9960-W-14653.3

 What is your 1915 position?
If you were to head into Fishers Island Sound, which of the following charts would you switch to for better detail of Mystic and Mystic Harbor?
From your 1915 position, you come left and set a course for Gardiners Point.  At 1930, your position is LAT 41°12.7'N, LONG 71°56.8'W.  What type of bottom is charted at this position?

From your 1930 position, you plot a course to pass 0.5 mile due south of Race Rock Light. If your vessel's speed is 10.0 knots, the current's set and drift are 040°T at 1.8 knots, and a north wind produces a 3° leeway, what true course should you steer to make good your desired course?

As an option to heading into Long Island Sound, you consider anchoring in the vicinity of the Gardiners Point Ruins at the north end of Gardiners Island.   What is the minimum recommended distance from the ruins for fishing, trawling, or anchoring?
NOAA VHF-FM weather broadcasts from New London, CT are on __________.

At 0705, you change course to head for The Race.  You wish to leave Race Rock Light bearing due north at 0.4 mile.  If the current is 110°T, at 2.8 knots, and you are turning for 12.0 knots, what course (pgc) should you steer?

options: You are already governed by the Inland Rules.
You will not be governed by the Inland Rules.
question: You are bound for New London.  Where will you cross the demarcation line and be governed by the Inland Rules of the Road?

You are steering 087°pgc and turning for 6.8 knots.  At 0600, you take the following loran readings:

 9960-W-14784.4
 9960-X-26208.3
 9960-Y-43959.1

What is your 0600 position?
If you change course at 0610, what is the course to steer to a point where Little Gull Island Light bears 180°T at 0.7 mile (Point "A")?
What is your ETA at point "A"?
You calculate that the current will be ebbing at the Race at 0700.  You should expect to be set in which general direction at the Race?

As you near Little Gull Island, you use your loran to insure that you do not come within 0.5 mile of the island. Which of the following loran readings will act as a danger line and keep you off Little Gull Island by a minimum of 0.5 mile?
From point "A", you lay out an intended track line to a point where Block Island North Light bears 180°T at 2.9 miles (Point "B").  What is the length of this leg of the voyage?
What is the course per standard magnetic compass between points "A" and "B"?

options: You are governed by the Inland Rules.
You are in a cable area.
You are to the left of your track line.
question:
At 0715 you take the following bearings:

 Race Rock Light         328°pgc 
 Little Gull Island Light   249°pgc 
 Mt. Prospect Antenna  036°pgc  

Based on your 0715 fix, which statement is TRUE?

From your 0715 position, you set a course of 085°T.  At 0745 you take the following bearings:

 Race Rock Light                             278°pgc  
 Watch Hill Light                               049°pgc  
 Fisher's Island East Harbor Cupola  010°pgc  

What was the current encountered between 0715 and 0745?
The wind is southerly, and you estimate 3° leeway. Allowing for leeway, what is the course to steer from your 0745 position to pass 1 mile south of Watch Hill Buoy "WH"?

From your 0745 fix, you change course to pass 1.0 mile south of buoy "WH" and estimate your speed at 7 knots.  If the visibility clears, what is the earliest time you can expect to see Block Island North Light tower?

options: Sandy beaches broken by rocky points
question: Which statement describes the shore between Watch Hill Point and Point Judith?
At 0830, Watch Hill Point bears 343°T at 3.5 miles by radar.  What was the speed made good since 0745?

options: You are to the left of the track line.
The bottom in the area is sand and gravel.
You are governed by the Inland Rules.
question:
At 0900, you take the following radar ranges:

Watch Hill Point                5.4 miles  
Block Island Grace Point  8.3 miles  

Which statement about this fix is TRUE?

At 0930, your position is LAT 41°16.5'N, LONG 71°41.4'W, and you are turning for 7 knots.  Allowing 3° leeway for southerly winds and estimating the current as 035° at 0.3 knot, what is the course to steer (pgc) to point "B"?
At 0227, you take the following radar ranges and bearings:   Bartlett Reef Light 359°T at 2.4 miles,  Race Rock Light 083°T at 4.1 miles.  What is your 0227 position?
At 0227, you are on course 087°T at 10 knots.  What course per standard magnetic compass should you steer to make good your true course?
You estimate that you are making 9.3 knots over the ground.   At what time will you enter waters governed by the COLREGS?

At 0337, fog closes in and you anchor under the following radar ranges and bearing:

 South tip of Watch Hill Point  3.0 miles  
 East point of Fishers Island    1.4 miles 
 Latimer Reef Light                 331°T  

What is the approximate depth of water at your anchorage?

options: sparsely wooded hills and is fringed with shoals to the south
sheer cliffs rising from the sea to a high, flat plateau
barren, rocky hills with prominent sandy beaches
low and sandy beaches with salt ponds and marsh grass
question: By 1015, visibility has increased to 5.0 miles and you can see Fishers Island.  Fishers Island has __________.
You get underway at 1030.  The wind is out of the SSE and you estimate 3° leeway.  What course should you steer per gyrocompass to make good a desired course of 075°T?
Shortly after getting underway, you sight Stonington Outer Breakwater Light in line with Stonington Inner Breakwater Light bearing 000° per gyrocompass.  Which statement is TRUE?

At 1104, Watch Hill Point Light is in line with Stonington Outer Breakwater Light, the range to the south tip of Watch Hill Point is 2.6 miles and the range to the beach is 1.9 miles.  You are steering to make good 075°T, speed 10.0 knots.  At 1110, you change course to head for a position of LAT 41°05.0'N, LONG 71°50.0'W.  What is the true course?
At 1110, you increase speed to 12 knots.  What is your ETA at the new position?

options: There is no loran reading to follow.
question: You can follow what loran reading between your two positions?

At 1345, you depart from a position 1 mile due east of Montauk Point Light and set course for Block Island Southeast Light at 9 knots.  At 1430, you take the following loran readings:

 9960-W-14600.8
 9960-Y-43866.3
 9960-X-25912.3

What was the current encountered since 1345?

options: Continue on the same course but increase speed.
Continue on the same course at the same speed.
Slow to 8.3 knots to compensate for the current.
Alter course to the right, to pass well clear of Southwest Ledge
question: You are encountering heavy weather.  What action should you take based on your 1430 fix?

At 2100, you set course of 000°T, speed 10 knots from LAT 41°07.0'N, LONG 71°30.0'W.  Visibility is 5.5 n.m.  What is the earliest time you can expect to sight Point Judith Light? (Use charted range of 20 miles as nominal range.)
You estimate the current to be 160°T at 1.2 knots.  What should your course and speed be in order to make good 000°T at 10 knots?
If you want to put into Point Judith Harbor of Refuge, what chart should you use?

At 0630, you pass Buoy "PI" close abeam on the starboard side.  You are steering 078°T and are headed directly toward Race Rock Light.  At 0654, Little Gull Island Light is bearing 207°T and Race Rock Light is bearing 072°T. What is your 0654 position?
What is your speed from your 0630 position, with Buoy "PI" close abeam, to your 0654 position?
At 0700, your gyro alarm sounds.  What course should you steer by the standard magnetic compass in order to maintain your original heading of 078°T?
At 0705, with your gyro again functioning properly, you change course to 096°T.  At this time Race Rock Light is bearing 000°T at 0.35 mile.  You are now governed by which Navigation Rules?
At 0728, Race Rock Light is bearing 282°T at 3.8 miles, and the closest point on Fishers Island is at a radar range of 2.1 miles.  What speed have you been making since you changed course at 0705?
At 0728, you change course to 080°T.  When steady on course, the standard magnetic compass reads 097°.  Which statement is TRUE?

At 0748, you take the following Loran-C readings:

 9960-W-14651.0
 9960-X-26034.8
 9960-Y-43943.8

What is the approximate depth of water at this position?
At 0748, you change course to 160°T.  What loran reading can you follow to remain on this course?

At 0815, Montauk Pt. Light House is bearing 167°T, Shagwong Pt. has a radar range of 4.5 miles, and Cerberus Shoal "9" Buoy is bearing 284°T.  If the engine is making turns for 10 knots, what was the set and drift of the current since 0748?

options: Continue on the same course and speed.
Alter your course to the right.
Alter your course to the left.
question: What action should you take to compensate for the above current?

options: low and rocky with scattered small pine trees
question: At 0815, visibility is excellent and you can see Montauk Point.  Montauk Point is __________.

At 0815, you change course to 079°T and head for the entrance of Great Salt Pond on Block Island.  To compensate for a northerly wind, you estimate a 5° leeway is necessary.  What course should you steer per gyrocompass to make good 079°T?
At 0845, Montauk Pt. Light is bearing 205°T at a radar distance of 6.6 miles.  What is your speed made good from your 0815 position?

options: It will remain visible to Great Salt Pond.
question: As you head toward Great Salt Pond, visibility is unlimited.  At what time will you lose sight of Montauk Pt. Light?
Which chart should you use to enter Great Salt Pond?

At 0520, you take the following observations:

Point Judith Light                                032°pgc  
Point Judith Harbor of Refuge  
         Main Breakwater Center Light   308°pgc  

What is the position of your 0520 fix?

options: is used mostly by towing vessels
has a maximum depth of 14 feet at MHW
is entered through the East Gap or the West Gap
is easily accessible in heavy southerly seas
question: Point Judith Harbor of Refuge __________.
At 0520 you are on course 243°pgc at 12 knots.  What is the course per standard magnetic compass?

options: sandy and broken by rocky points
question: The coastline between Point Judith and Watch Hill is __________.
In clear weather, how far away will you sight Point Judith Light?
At what time will you cross the 60 foot curve if you make good 12 knots?

options: recommended approaches to Green Hill Point
question: The two wavy magenta lines running to Green Hill Point represent __________.

At 0600 your loran reads:   

 9960-W-14542.5
 9960-X-25909.5
 9960-Y-43950.0
 
What is your 0600 position?
What was the current between 0520 and 0600?
From your 0600 position, what is the course per gyrocompass to leave Watch Hill Light abeam to starboard at 2.0 miles if a southerly wind is producing 3° of leeway?
At 0645, Watch Hill Point (left tangent) bears 314.5°T at 2.75 miles.  What was the speed made good between 0600 and 0645?

Watch Hill Light      030.5°pgc  
Latimer Reef Light  329.0°pgc  
Race Rock Light    262.0°pgc  

What was the true course made good between 0645 and 0705?

options: You are already governed by the Inland Rules.
You will not be governed by the Rules.

options: The true line of the range is 072°.

Light?

 Montauk Point Light                  267°pgc 
 Block Island Southeast Light     030°pgc  
 Radar Bearing to Block Island   
         Southwest Point (tangent) 352°pgc  

What is your position at the time of these sightings?
Which course would you steer by your standard magnetic compass to make good a course of 275°T?

options: on a vessel engaged in public safety activity
question: From your position you observe a rotating white and green light to the north.  This light is most likely __________.

options: You are to the left of your DR track.
You are inside a precautionary area.
Your speed made good from 1949 to 2027 is 14.0 knots.
Your course made good from 1949 to 2027 is 111°T.
question: At 2027 you obtain a radar range to Shagwong Point of 3.4 miles and a tangent bearing to the east end of Long Island of 172°T.  Which statement is TRUE?

At 2045 you obtained the following Loran readings:
 9960-W-14844.0
 9960-X-26128.0
 9960-Y-43712.5
 What is your vessel's position?
At what time would you expect to be abeam of Buoy "MP"?
At 2100 your position is 40°44.1'N, 72°07.6'W.  From this position, at which time will Montauk Point Light become visible if the luminous range of the light is 8 miles?
At 2146 your position is 40°51.3'N, 71°59.2'W.  If your engine speed has been 13 knots, what were the set and drift of the current you encountered since your 2100 position?
At 2146 if your fathometer is set on feet, what should be the approximate reading on your fathometer?

From your 2146 position, with a new engine speed of 12 knots, you wish to change course in order to pass southeast of Buoy "MP" at a distance of 2 miles.  With a reported set of 320° true and a drift of 2 knots, which course should you steer to make good your desired course?

At 2310 Buoy "MP" bears 305° true with a radar range of 2.5 miles, and you obtained a Loran reading of 9960-Y-43823.3.
From this position you change course to 005° true.  Without any set and drift, what would be your predicted distance off Southwest Ledge Buoy "2" when it is on your starboard beam?

options: You are being set to the north.
The fathometer reading is about 14 fathoms.
You are governed by the Inland Rules of the Road.
The fathometer trace shows you passed over the 89 foot sounding.
question: At 2357 your position is 41°09.0'N, 71°47.0'W and Montauk Point Light bears 216° true.  You change to a course of 293° true and your speed is 14.5 knots.  At 0012 Montauk Point Light bears 177° true.  Which statement about your 0012 running fix is TRUE?

At 0016 your position is 41°10.3'N, 71°53.0'W.  You are steering a course of 296° true with no set and drift.  At 0049 Race Rock Light is on your starboard beam.  What was your speed made good from your 0016 position?
At 1705 Race Rock Light bears 099°True; Orient Point Light bears 176°True; Bartlett Reef Light bears 083°True.  What is your vessel's position?
If there is no set or drift, at what time would you be abeam of Bartlett Reef Light?

At 1718, Bartlett Reef Light bears 050°T at a distance of 1.5 miles.  From this position, you change course to 128°
T.  At 1750 Race Rock Light bears 336°T, Little Gull Island Light bears 285°T, and Montauk Point Light bears 134°T.  What were the set and drift of the current you encountered since 1718?
If your fathometer is set on fathoms, what should your fathometer read at 1750?

At 1756 you determined your vessel's position to be 41°10.4'N, 71°59.2'W.  From this position, you wish to change course to head for a point 5 miles west of Block Island North Light.  With a reported set of 050°T, a drift of 2.0 knots and turning RPM's for 14 knots, which course should you steer to make good your desired course?

options: You are governed by the Inland Rules of the Road.
You are to the left (north) of your desired course line.
Your vessel is approximately 8.7 miles off Sandy Point.
question:
At 1844 you obtained the following Loran readings:

 9960-W-14607
 9960-X-25962
 9960-Y-43920

 Which statement is TRUE?

From your 1850 position of 41°12.8'N, 71°44.1'W, you change course to 060°T. If you make the course good,
what will be your predicted distance off Point Judith Light when the Light bears 015°T?

options: You are on the edge of a cable area.
The bottom is mud, sand, and clay.
The wavy magenta lines to the north through east of your position are designated lobstering areas.
Following a Loran-C reading of 9960-Y-43941 or more will keep you to the south of Point Judith Buoy "2".
question: You are making good a course of 060°T at a speed of 13.5 knots.  At 1855 Block Island North Light bears 086°T; at 1910 Block Island North Light bears 108°T; and at 1930 the same light bears 184°T.  Which statement is TRUE about your 1930 running fix position?
At 1942 Point Judith bears 030°T and has a range of 3.6 miles and Sandy Point has a range of 5.3 miles.  What was your speed made good from your 1850 position?

  Montauk Point Light                                            263°pgc  
  Block Island Southeast Light                               026°pgc

 What is your position at the time of these sightings?
What course should you steer by your standard magnetic compass to make good a course of 280°T?

options: from a submarine on the surface

options: Horizontally banded, green over red, with a green buoyancy chamber
Horizontally banded, red over green, with a red buoyancy chamber

options: recommended approaches to Green Hill Point

 Point Judith Harbor of Refuge

 What is the position of your 0520 fix?

options: is used mostly by towing vessels
has a maximum depth of 14 feet (4.3 meters) at MHW
West Gap has a controlling depth of 24 feet
is entered through the East Gap or the West Gap

options: marked by waterfalls from the highland ponds

At 2009 you are leaving New London Harbor with buoy "2"
close abeam to port.  What is the true course to the Race that will leave Race Rock Light 0.5 mile abeam to port?

At 2016 you sight N. Dumpling Light in line with Latimer Reef Light (Fl 6 sec, 55 ft) bearing 079°pgc. At the time of the bearing the helmsman reported he was steering 164°
pgc and 172° per standard magnetic compass.  What is the deviation for that heading?

options: At the mouth of New London Harbor
After crossing the line of the Territorial Sea
After passing between Montauk Point and Lewis Point on Block Island

options: to the left of the track line
to the right of the track line
towards New London along the track line

  Race Rock Light     2.1 miles  
  Latimer Reef Light   6.4 miles
 
 If you estimate an average current of 080°T at 1.5 knots,
which course will you steer per gyrocompass to leave Endeavor Shoals Gong Buoy bearing 270°T at 1.5 miles?

options: Radar ranges to Southwest Point of less than 7.9 miles
Shagwong Reef Lighted Bell Buoy "7SR" 3.1 miles off  abeam
Race Rock Light bearing 299°T and decreasing
question: The light on Block Island Sound South Entrance Obstruction Buoy "BIS" is reported extinguished.  Which of the following will serve as a positive warning that you are being set onto the obstruction?

At 2045 visibility decreases in fog, and at 2103 you take the following loran fix:

 9960-W-14658
 9960-X-26012.5
 9960-Y-43904
 
Determine your 2103 fix.

options: You are inside the lobster pot area.
You are inside of the 90 foot curve.
You are outside the boundary of the Territorial Sea and Contiguous Zone.
question: You round Montauk Point and steer to make good 206°T. Speed is increased to 13.0 knots.  The current, if any, is unknown.  The visibility has improved and is estimated to be 5 miles.  At 2144 Montauk Point Light bears 273°T.  At 2202 the same light bears 320°T.  Which statement concerning your 2202 running fix is TRUE?
At 2229 the gyro fails.  What is the course to steer per standard magnetic compass to make good 206°T, if you allow 3° leeway for southeasterly winds?

At 0630, Buoy "PI" is close abeam on the starboard side. You are steering 078°T and are headed directly toward Race Rock Light.  At 0654, Little Gull Island Light is bearing 210°pgc and Race Rock Light is bearing 075°pgc.  What is your 0654 position?
What was the course made good from 0630 to 0654?

T.  At this time, you wish to change course to 288°T.  The current has a set of 355°T and a drift of 2.0 knots.  If your vessel is turning RPM's for 9 knots, what course must you steer in order to make your desired course good?

Buoy is located 3.6 miles off your starboard bow.

At 0040 you are south of Lewis Point when you receive word that the distress is terminated.  You alter course to head for The Race.  At 0052 you take the following relative bearings because the starboard gyro repeater is inoperative.  Your heading at each bearing was 285°pgc. What is your 0052 position?

  Race Rock Light 002°
 Watch Hill Light 034°
 Block Island North Light 122°

options: are being set to the right of the track
are making good more than 9.2 knots

options: The deviation table is correct for that heading.

question: In order to check your compasses, you sight Race Rock Light in line with New London Harbor Light bearing 336° per gyrocompass.  The helmsman reports the vessel was heading 275.0°pgc and 290.5° per standard magnetic compass at the time of the observation.  Which statement is TRUE?
